| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line799](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line799 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

The **duergar** is a monster added in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). It is basically a [dwarf lord](/wiki/Dwarf_lord "Dwarf lord") that is generated only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

## Generation

Due to their low [monster difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty"), duergar will never actually generate randomly in Gehennom. Very rarely, some of the random h in the Gnomish Mines may be duergar (a la [minesflayers](/wiki/Minesflayer "Minesflayer")).

They are a valid [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form, so they can occasionally appear that way, although since monster polymorph in SLASH'EM is temporary these will never be "real" duergar. Theoretically, one could generate "real" duergar through [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") or casting [stone-to-flesh](/wiki/Stone-to-flesh "Stone-to-flesh") on a wished-for statue, although there would be little point to doing either.

## Strategy

In theory, a weapon-wielding monster that polymorphs into a duergar could pose some danger; in practice this is incredibly unlikely, and even then one can simply walk away from them.

Duergar

From NetHackWiki

h duergar
Difficulty 6
Attacks Weapon 2d4, Weapon 2d4
h duergar
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Weapon 2d4, Weapon 2d4

Base level 4
Base experience 51
Speed 6
Base AC 10
Base MR 10
Alignment 5 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 900
Nutritional value 300
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A duergar:

  • can tunnel through walls.
  • needs a pick-axe to tunnel through walls.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is a dwarf.
  • is male.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • hits creatures as a +1 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line799

The duergar is a monster added in SLASH'EM. It is basically a dwarf lord that is generated only in Gehennom.

Generation

Due to their low monster difficulty, duergar will never actually generate randomly in Gehennom. Very rarely, some of the random h in the Gnomish Mines may be duergar (a la minesflayers).

They are a valid polymorph form, so they can occasionally appear that way, although since monster polymorph in SLASH'EM is temporary these will never be "real" duergar. Theoretically, one could generate "real" duergar through reverse genocide or casting stone-to-flesh on a wished-for statue, although there would be little point to doing either.

Strategy

In theory, a weapon-wielding monster that polymorphs into a duergar could pose some danger; in practice this is incredibly unlikely, and even then one can simply walk away from them.

The '''duergar''' is a monster added in [[SLASH'EM]].  It is basically a [[dwarf lord]] that is generated only in [[Gehennom]].  

==Generation==
Due to their low [[monster difficulty]], duergar will never actually generate randomly in Gehennom. Very rarely, some of the random {{white|h}} in the Gnomish Mines may be duergar (a la [[minesflayer]]s).

They are a valid [[polymorph]] form, so they can occasionally appear that way, although since monster polymorph in SLASH'EM is temporary these will never be "real" duergar. Theoretically, one could generate "real" duergar through [[reverse genocide]] or casting [[stone-to-flesh]] on a wished-for statue, although there would be little point to doing either.

==Strategy==

In theory, a weapon-wielding monster that polymorphs into a duergar could pose some danger; in practice this is incredibly unlikely, and even then one can simply walk away from them.
